intro: Pedicularis rupicola, commonly known as the rock beard or alpine beard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its hairy, upright stems and showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to red. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, often at high altitudes where conditions are harsh. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and delicate species.
